section.title: Physical Science
section.para: Physical Science is any science concerned with nonliving matter, energy, and the physical properties of the Universe, such as physics, chemistry, astronomy, and geology.
In this context, the OPFPS WG cover the following aspects:

section.title: OPFPS workflow
section.para: A basic OPFPS workflow could be summarized as the following:

listitem.para: requirement inception (eliciting requirements), to collect functional requirements (e.g. as use cases) and related non-functional requirements from scientific community (from scientific stakeholders);
enable ICT stakeholders to provide suitable solution.

section.para: This Note covers the requirement inception phase.

section.title: An iterative process
section.para: The proposed process is iterative, so that reference solutions can be reworked in the light of increased knowledge and to take under control the problems listed in . Iteration means that the scientific stakeholders should provide use cases and non-functional requirements and refine them based on feedbacks received by other stakeholders and by the OPFPS members. With an iterative process that will involve all stakeholders, those mistaken assumptions can be detected and corrected.
The OPFPS members are available to update the common workflow for each new use case that is added or updated.
Iterations will be made also on the proposed methodology:

listitem.para: defines a methodology (as the methodology proposed in this document);
apply methodology to concrete use case;
apply updated methodology to next use cases.
